content.body: Has there been any discussion around "nullish coallescing destructuring", that is, making something like `function a ({ x = 10 }) { }` "just work" for the `a()` case and having x just be set to 10 instead of throwing? Perhaps using syntax like `function a({ x ?= 10 }) { }` or something?
content.formatted_body: Has there been any discussion around "nullish coallescing destructuring", that is, making something like function a ({ x = 10 }) { } "just work" for the a() case and having x just be set to 10 instead of throwing? Perhaps using syntax like function a({ x ?= 10 }) { } or something?
